Title: the mystery date observation

Penny: I think it’s so adorable you’re making Sheldon breakfast.
Aren’t you worried you’re making French toast on oatmeal day?
Oh, I don’t want credit for that.
Oh. Good for you.
And you don’t want to make the same mistake with the next woman.
Don’t take advice from a man who threw his shoe at a crow.
Come on, Amy, show us the dress.
Uh, I don’t think any of your comfort zones are showing.
No one ever bought me drinks at a bar because my brain just popped out of my shirt.
Ooh.
Yeah, come on, tell us more.
Well, we’re your best friends, give us one more detail and we promise we’ll leave you alone.
All right, where is tall British Dave taking you?
Good luck. I threw out all my tall ones when I married Leonard.
We don’t even know what time they’re gonna be there.
Damn, you’re sneaky.
Oh, I forgot to tell you, we’re gonna meet up with Bernadette to spy on Amy and her date.
What, and you think I want to see a documentary about aluminium can recycling?
No, it’s the movie your wife doesn’t want you to see.
You’re not curious who she’s out with?
But you’re curious about aluminium cans? You’re a weird little guy.
Hey. So, where are they?
Oh, damn it, we should have brought binoculars.
Oh, there he is.
Yeah.
What, now you’re interested? You didn’t even want to come.
Fine.
Your what?
He really seems into her.
What? Here, give me, give me. Oh, my God. Oh, my God, they’re coming right towards us.
Okay. Well, wait, what about Leonard?
Oh, no.
Leonard: Well, he’s having a rough time. Amy broke his heart, the DVR cut off the last minute of Doctor Who. That crow followed him home.
Ah, well, what’s this? A pot of oatmeal? Or, thanks to you, what I will now call gloatmeal.
You’re in a good mood.
What brought this on?
Hey, I made French toast sticks.
Ah, I also made oatmeal.
I don’t understand why we’re leaving so early for the movie.
What? I don’t want to do that.
This is the movie that big soda doesn’t want you to see.
So you’re actually okay with invading your friend’s privacy?
Not really.
You just happen to have those in the car?
By stalking them?
Can I see?
I know, but you guys make being a crappy friend look fun.
Yeah, okay, I see him. It looks like they’re having a nice time. I wish I could hear what they’re saying.
Okay, we saw them. Can we go catch the movie?
Are we gonna be much longer? I really have to go to the bathroom.
What happened?
Yeah.
I don’t know if you want to do that, I was just, okay, never mind.
You really should.
Sheldon: Oh, Dr. and Mrs. Hofstadter, lovely to see you this fine morning.
Yeah, I am indeed. I have decided, instead of wallowing in sadness about Amy, it is time that I find myself a new female companion.
I realized something. When Amy was in my life, I was hyper-focused on my work and ignored her.
No, I need a new woman in my life to ignore so I can hyper-focus on my work again.
On oatmeal day?
Ooh, that’s a lot of carbohydrates for a man on the prowl. You know what? You eat it. You’re married, it doesn’t matter what you look like.
Thank you for coming by, gentlemen.
Well, it was the two of you who found Amy Farrah Fowler for me. Now that I’m looking for my next girlfriend, it seemed only logical that I employ your services once again.
Oh, no, it’s all right. I think of my time with Amy as a stick of Fruit Stripe gum. Sweet and enjoyable at first, but ultimately a flavourless lump of sadness.
Gentlemen.

All I’m looking for is an educated, intelligent woman who shares my interests while retaining her own unique point of view. She should be kind, patient, and most important, unable to imagine life without me by ten o’clock tonight.
All right, fine, she doesn’t need her own point of view. Now, chop-chop.
Are you sure? I’ve heard that on those sites, often when you think you’re corresponding with someone, it’s actually a computer program pretending to be a real person.
Excuse me. No one does a better job pretending to be a person than I do. Siri comes close, but I know more jokes.

Off the top of my head? Uh, prospective women weed themselves out in a battle of wits until only one champion remains, and she shows up at my door flush with the thrill of victory, and then sits quietly by my side while I watch Daredevil.
People compete for jobs and trophies, why not me?
And I have the soulful eyes of a cow.
Oh, we’ll make the puzzles extremely challenging to eliminate unworthy candidates.
That’s it. The Sheldon Cooper Girlfriend Challenge is officially live.
Right now, somewhere, a woman is dividing the atomic weight of the best noble gas by the number of colours in the oldest national flag still in use.
And, taking her first step towards a lifetime of laughter, love and, best of all, rules.
Golly, she sounds too good to be true.
Someone will show.
Someone will show.
Well, by that logic, I should be with someone short, dull and needy, eh? Not to cast aspersions, but I can’t shake a stick around here without hitting that.
One minute is a long time.
45 seconds is plenty of time for a woman to walk through that door and fall in love with me. You know, probably half that if I break out the old cow eyes.
Uh-oh. What if it’s Jennifer Lawrence?
Well, that last Hunger Games was not my cup of tea.
Oh, fine, I won’t shut my heart to the love of Jennifer Lawrence.
Sounds like a drama queen. Oh, no. It is Jennifer Lawrence.
All right. Can I help you?
Yes.
Careful, it’s addictive.
And just like that, you’re a Klingon-Sanskrit junkie.
I am a bit of a unicorn. Well, you certainly seem like a special lady, uh, but as you know, you missed the deadline, so thanks for playing.
She was late. And she found atomic spectroscopy boring. Well, I wouldn’t coitus her with your genitals.
Howard: No problem.
You sure you’re up for that? She did hurt you.
Hubba Bubba over Dubble Bubble? You’re crazy.
But what are you looking for?
Isn’t that a little unreasonable?
I think the quickest way to find you a new girlfriend is just to get you on every dating Web site out there.
If you don’t want to use dating Web sites, what do you suggest?
You seriously think women would fight for you?
He’s right, he knows a lot of jokes.
Well, he’s smart, he’s a respected scientist.
I have an idea. What if we put a post on Craigslist that says world-class Caltech physicist seeking girlfriend. If interested, solve the following puzzles for a chance to meet him.
Well, this is actually an interesting social experiment.
Me, too. And we’ve seen the prize.
Congratulations.
Then using that number as the average speed to calculate the travel time from Mordor to the Shire.
Well, if she can solve them, it’ll prove she’s intelligent, tenacious and so socially awkward she has nothing better to do on a Saturday night.
And no matter what happens, this is still a fun experiment.
I’ve been telling women that for 20 years.
What?
You thought she was great in X-Men.
Maybe she’s waiting to show up at the last possible moment.
Maybe we did make the test too difficult.
It’s an actual girl, and she’s really pretty.
Raj: So what’s up?
You’re not wrong about Fruit Stripe. I was always a Hubba Bubba man.
Hey, the jaw wants what it wants.
Oh, right, uh, girlfriend. Okay.
And you’re afraid it’ll do a better job than you?
Yeah, no, but it is basic human nature. If we present him as a prize, maybe they would.
I don’t know if I’d say you… oh.
Oh, we could set it up like a scavenger hunt where the last puzzle gives the winner Sheldon’s contact information.
I’m a little jealous of the people who get to do it.
This is exciting.
I, I hope we didn’t make the puzzles too hard.
37 minutes left until the deadline.
Not as fun as the night we blew up grapes in the microwave. We really have led full lives.
Maybe you don’t want someone exactly like you. You know what they say, opposites attract.
Sixty seconds. This is not looking good.
Forty-five.
Thirty seconds.
Guys, fifteen seconds.
Five, four, three, two, one. That’s too bad.

I don’t think it matters. Look, Sheldon, I believe when the time is right for you to meet someone, it’ll just happen. Okay? Not because of a test or a Web site, but because… (knock on door) we are the dreamers of dreams.
Answer it.
How could you send her away?
Amy: Okay. But I’m really stepping outside of my comfort zone here.
Well, some people think the sexiest organ is the brain.
Do you have any heels higher than this? He’s pretty tall.
Well, I told you his name and that he’s tall. What more do you need?
Just a little peck on the lips.
Fine. Um, he’s British. All right, that is a juicy one.
To that new Italian place on Walnut.
I’m gonna go look for other shoes.
Well, I’m having a good time, too. If you don’t mind me asking, why did you and your wife split up?
Oh, I’m, I’m so sorry.
No. I mean, to be completely honest, I’ve, I’ve only been in one long-term relationship.
That’s a good question. After five years, it was just feeling like more work than it should be.
No. He’s a theoretical physicist at Caltech.
Um, used to be string theory, now it’s dark matter. But let’s not discuss Sheldon. Let’s get back to you.
I’m trying not to. Do you know him?
Sure, why not?
Um about an hour and half.
Yes. Yep. We were on a date. Very much like this one.
What was the rest of your question?
Really? You-you want me to introduce you to my ex-boyfriend?
I have a DVD of that lecture.
Not as a Valentine’s present, no.
That’s, um, terrific. Listen, I’m, I’m kind of tired. Can we call it a night?
No, you’re not.
Thank you.
What are you guys doing here?
No. Pinch me.
No problem. I’m really sorry about your car.
Um, listen, you’re a really nice guy, but I just, I don’t think this is working out.
I’m, I’m really sorry.
There you go.
Sure. Heh.
Okay, get out.
Bernadette: Yeah, it’s your third date, maybe you could go more sexy.
Ooh, tall. Finally some details about this mystery man.
Did you kiss him yet?
Tea and basketball?
Oh, nice.
Hey, you want to swing by that place tonight and get a look at this guy?
I’ll just call the restaurant, pretend I’m Amy and check the reservation.
Yeah, but I’m little, so it’s adorable.
Across the street, in the left window.
Right here.
Kinda. Before I met Howie, I liked to keep close tabs on my boyfriends.
No. Stalkers are creepy. I’m just a harmless little girl with military-grade spy equipment.
He’s cute, right?
Yeah, I should’ve brought my parabolic microphone.
Nothing. Not important.
I took a video. I forgot how much fun this is.
Why’d you bring him?
Ugh, I hear that.
Right here.
Hey, hey, they’re leaving.
We got to get out of here.
He and his tiny bladder can take the bus. (Reverses into car behind)
Hi, Ames, what are you doing here?
Tall British Dave: This is fun. I haven’t dated much since my divorce.
Dave: Oh, you know how it is, we wanted different things. I wanted children, and she wanted a pastry chef named Jean-Philippe.
No, it’s, it’s fine. It’s why I left England. It reminded me too much of her. Cold, gloomy and easily accessed by a Frenchman through a tunnel.
So you’ve never been married?
Oh. What happened with that?
Oh, that’s too bad. Was he a neurobiologist like you?
I love teaching math, but that would be my dream job. What’s his focus?
Wait, you’re not talking about Dr. Sheldon Cooper?
No, but I’ve followed his work for years. He’s a rock star. You’ve got to tell me about him. What’s he like?
I’m sorry, just one more question about Sheldon.
It’s more of a four-part question, really. When he wrote his paper on supersingular prime numbers, how long did it take?
Wow. I mean, wow. And you were there to see it?
Mm. I doubt it was like this one. I mean, he’s a genius, and I wasn’t even smart enough to figure out why my wife always smelled of croissants.
Do you think you could introduce me to him?
You’re right, it’s, it’s weird. No, wait. Do it. No. I changed my mind. I’d be too nervous. Oh, I don’t know what to do.
You know, I once drove 500 miles to hear him speak at Stanford.
Really? Wasn’t it great?
Well, the next time you watch it, I’m the bloke who asked the question that he said was stupid and obvious. It was the nicest thing he said to anyone there.
Oh, gosh. Sorry, I’ve just spent the whole night talking about your ex-boyfriend. I’m such an idiot.
Well, maybe not an idiot, but certainly not as smart as someone we won’t mention.
That you said you might introduce me to, I’m free on Thursday.
She just hit my car.
O-M-G. Aren’t you Leonard Hofstadter?
I saw you speak at Stanford with Sheldon Cooper. Amy, can you believe it? It’s Dr. Leonard Hofstadter.
It’s an absolute pleasure to meet you. Can I shake your hand?
Amy, I’m never washing this hand again.
Uh, thanks for driving me home.
Oh, it’s all right. If you’re free next weekend, I’d love to take you out again.
Oh. Okay.
No, it’s, at least the same woman that rejected Sheldon Cooper rejected me.
If I ever do meet him, we’ll have that in common.
And, he’s kissed you and I’ve kissed you, so if you think about it…
Girl: Um, are you the physicist that placed the ad on Craigslist?

Hi. I’m Vanessa Bennett. Sorry it took a while for me to get here. I was stuck in this boring symposium on atomic spectroscopy when I came across your ad, and it saved my night. The puzzles were, were really fun. I’ve never had to translate Klingon into ancient Sanskrit before.
Vanessa: Chija”e’vlKub je. Or, as they say in Sanskrit, Ahm asman matey-bee ta-teyva.

Anyway, I, I just, I knew I had to meet the person responsible for such a brilliant idea. And I don’t need to tell you, there aren’t a lot of men who love physics, archaic languages and flags of the world.
